text: Nineveh Creek is a stream in Johnson and Bartholomew counties, Indiana, in the United States. Nineveh Creek was named for Nineveh Berry, a pioneer who fell into the creek while in pursuit of a deer. ==See also== *List of rivers of Indiana ==References== Category:Bodies of water of Bartholomew County, Indiana Category:Rivers of Johnson County, Indiana Category:Rivers of Indiana
title: Nineveh Creek
